revised_title: Gelation of Aluminum Soaps in Hydrocarbon: The Role of Water and Hydroxyl Group
tldr: This article investigates the gelation of aluminum soaps in hydrocarbon, focusing on the effect of water and the role of the hydroxyl group. The authors find that the presence of water initiates gelation, which increases until a maximum is reached, after which the soap precipitates. The study also examines the association of aluminum alkoxides and their stability in compounds.
